Exaggerate: The claim of "half the workforce in the country may have just been idled" exaggerates the extent of the impact on the workforce.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support or evidence to back up the assertion that half of the workforce has been idled.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all unemployment claims represent idled workers, without considering factors such as furloughed employees or those working reduced hours.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the number of unemployment claims filed (26 million) is not half of the total U.S. workforce (160 million).
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the unemployment claims, such as people who could not file their forms or were not included in the official count.
